title: Location Geographic Data Schema
description: Physical characteristics, positioning, and environmental properties of a location.

latitude.description: North-South position on the globe, from -90째 (South Pole) to 90째 (North Pole).

longitude.description: East-West position on the globe, from -180째 to 180째.

elevation.description: Height above or below sea level, which may include a range or average for large locations.

planar_coordinates.description: For fictional worlds with non-Earth coordinate systems, the appropriate positioning information.

dimensional_position.description: For locations existing outside normal space-time, their position relative to other dimensions or planes.

coordinates.description: The spatial positioning of this location, using the most appropriate coordinate system for its context.

value.description: The numerical measurement of this location's physical area.

unit.description: The unit of measurement for the area value.

area.description: The physical size of this location.

dominant_features.description: The primary physical characteristics that define this location's landscape.

biome.description: The ecological community type that characterizes this location.

notable_topography.description: Distinctive aspects of the land's shape, elevation changes, or other physical features that make this location recognizable.

terrain.description: The physical environment and land characteristics of this location.

classification.description: The general climate category or type, which may follow standard classifications or use world-specific terminology.

temperature_range.description: The typical minimum and maximum temperatures experienced in this location, with seasonal variations if applicable.

seasons.description: How the yearly climate cycle progresses in this location, including any unusual or magical seasonal patterns.

notable_weather.description: Distinctive weather phenomena or patterns that this location is known for.

climate.description: The typical atmospheric conditions and weather patterns of this location.

feature.description: The geographic feature that forms a natural border (e.g., river, mountain range, ocean).

direction.description: Which side of the location this feature borders.

permeability.description: How easily this boundary can be crossed.

entity.description: The political entity neighboring this location.

direction.description: Which side of the location this entity borders.

relation.description: The diplomatic relationship with this neighboring entity.

realm.description: The dimension, plane, or alternate reality that interfaces with this location.

nature.description: How the boundary between dimensions manifests at this location.

stability.description: How consistent or changeable the boundary between realms is at this point.

borders.description: Natural and artificial boundaries that define the edges of this location.

direction.description: The orientation or spatial relationship between this location and the adjacent one.

distance.description: How far away the adjacent location is, in appropriate units.

type.description: The kind of pathway or route (e.g., 'highway', 'trail', 'underground tunnel', 'ley line').

condition.description: The state of repair or usability of this route.

travel_time.description: How long it typically takes to travel this route by conventional means.

connectivity.description: How this location connects to neighboring areas and the wider world.
